alert.note: Alert for Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 06 at 8:19PM PST until December 07 at 5:34PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner and Boundary and Northeast Washington, including the following counties, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...Until 400 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 PM PST, Rain and snowmelt continues. This will cause urban and small stream flooding as well as flooding in poor drainage areas. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen, locally between 5 to 8 inches in the mountains. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Colville, Chewelah, Newport, Ponderay, Moyie Springs, Kootenai, Dover, Clark Fork, East Hope, Nordman, Copeland, Kettle Falls, Ione, Northport, Springdale, Metaline Falls and Cusick. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
